_header: Ho quod the Knight good sir no more of this
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Nun’s Priest’s Prologue of The Canterbury Tales — 53 lines in couplets, occurring in two forms, one lacking lines VII.2771-90.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
HOo sir quod the knyght no more of thisthat ye han seide is right I
                    now I wis…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…and thus he seide to vs euerychonthis swete prest this goodly
                    man sir Iohn
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
Here the Knyght interipteth and stynteth / the Monke of his tale (margin,
                    f. 206); prolog (RT); here the Ost com / maunded the Nonnes prest to / telle his
                    tale of Chaunteclere / and Perelote (f. 206, margin, next to VII.2808); Here
                    endith the Nonnys Prest his prolog / and next folwyng bigynneth his tale (f.
                    206)

BodBar20.First Lines:
HO quod the knyght good sir no more of þisþat ȝe
                    haue saide is right I nowh Iwys…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…And þus he saide to vs euerychonÞis swete preost
                    þis goode man sir Iohan
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
…and here / bygynnyth þe the prologe of the Nonne Preost (f.
                        245v); Here endithe the prolog… (f. 246)

Bod414.First Lines:
[H]O quod the knight good sire nomore of þisThat ye haue seid
                    it is riȝt enough y wis…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…And thus he seid to us euerichoneThis swete prest this good
                    man ser Iohn

BodHatDon1.First Lines:
HO quod þe knight gode sir no more of thisThat ye haue seid is
                    right I now I wis…
BodHatDon1.Last Lines:
…And thus he seid to vs eueri choneThis swete prest this
                    goodly man sir Iohn
BodHatDon1.Attributed Title:
…And next beginneth þe prolog of the Nonne Preste (rubric, f.
                    216); The Nonne (RT); Here endeth the prolog… (rubric, f. 224)

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
HO sire quod þe knight no more of þisÞat ye han said
                    is right I nough Iwis…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…And þus he saide vn to vs euery choneÞis swete
                    prest þis goodli man sir Iohne
BodLauMis600.Attributed Title:
…Here begyneth the prolog of the nonne prestes tale of the cok / and
                    of þe henne (f. 258); þe nonne prest (RT)

OxfChrCh152.First Lines:
Ho quod oure oste good sire no more of thisThat ye han seide is

…And thus he seide vnto vs euerychonThis swete preest this
                    goodly man sir Iohn
OxfChrCh152.Attributed Title:

OxfNew314.First Lines:
HO quod our ost sir no more of thisThat ye haue said ys ynouȝ
                    ywis…
OxfNew314.Last Lines:

OxfNew314.Attributed Title:

OxfTri49.First Lines:
O quod the knyght goode sire no more of thisthat ye haue seide is
                    right I now I wis…
OxfTri49.Last Lines:

CULDd424.First Lines:
Hoo quod the knyght good sire nomore of thisThat ȝe han seid
                    is right I now I wys…
CULDd424.Last Lines:
…Thanne spak oure hoost with rude speche & boldeAnd seide
                    vnto the Nonnes preest anoon…
CULDd424.Note:
The collation includes missing leaves; f. 188 is missing, taking with it
                    lines VII.2810-20 of the Prologue.
CULDd424.Attributed Title:
Heere bigynneth the Prologe of the Nonnes Preest (f. 187v, above
                    the written space)
CULDd424.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             The Cambridge MS. Dd.4.24 of Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales,
                Completed by the Egerton MS. 2726 (The Haistwell MS).
The Chaucer Society
         1st Series, no. 95 (Part 1, issue for 1901) and 96 (Part 2, issue for
            1902).

CULIi326.First Lines:
NOwe quod the knyght sir no more of thisThat ye haue saide is right
                    Enough y wis…
CULIi326.Last Lines:
…And thus he saide to vs euerychoneThis swete preest this
                    gostly man sir Iohn
CULIi326.Attributed Title:
Nonnes preste (RT); Here endeth the prologe of the nonnes preest… (f.
                        211v)

CULMm25.First Lines:
Ho quod þe knyght gode sir no more of þisThat ye han said
                    is right ynogh y wys…
CULMm25.Last Lines:
…And þus he seide to us euyerchonThis swete preste
                    þis good man sir Ione
CULMm25.Attributed Title:
…Here begynneth þe prologe of þe none priste tale (f.
                        163v); þe Nonne preste (RT); Here endith þe
                    prologe… (f. 164v)

CamFitzMc181.First Lines:
[H]Oo quoth the knyght sir no more of thisThat ye haue seid hit ys
                    y nowh ywysse…
CamFitzMc181.Last Lines:
…And þus his tale told to us euerychoneThis swete preste
                    this godeman sir Iohn
CamFitzMc181.Attributed Title: The prolog of the Nonnes Preste (f. 256)

BLEge2863.First Lines:
HO quod the knight good sire no more of thisþat ȝe han
                    seide is right I now I wys…

NLW21972D.Last Lines:
…And seyde vnto þe nonnes preest anoonCome nere thow
                    preest come hider thow Sir Iohn

The first of three damaged leaves, this one containing lines
                    VII.2784-2820 of the Prologue on the recto.
